summary: G. Robert Blakey was the Chief Counsel and Staff Director for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from the U.S. House of Representatives detailing the employees, their positions, and salaries for the HSCA from October 1977 to March 1979. Blakey's name appears on these documents as the head of the committee, indicating his leadership role in the investigation into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The documents highlight his administrative role in managing the committee's staff and resources during the investigation.
significance: As Chief Counsel and Staff Director for the HSCA, G. Robert Blakey played a central role in the investigation into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. He was responsible for overseeing the committee's research, investigations, and ultimately, its conclusions regarding the assassination.
